channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Boxed in by shifting tariff rules, European shippers pause some U.S.-bound parcels
item.description: New customs regulations take effect August 29, and many European postal agencies and companies say until new systems are set up they can't ship some goods. Gifts worth less than $100 are not affected.
item.content:encoded:
New customs regulations take effect August 29, and many European postal agencies and companies say until new systems are set up they can't ship some goods. Gifts worth less than $100 are not affected.

(Image credit: Nicolas Guyannet/Hans Lucas)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Evacuations ordered as wildfire blazes California's famed Napa County
item.description: Firefighters are working to contain a blaze currently tearing through California's beloved wine country.
item.content:encoded:
Firefighters are working to contain a blaze currently tearing through California's beloved wine country.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Trump administration halts work on an almost-finished wind farm
item.description: The Revolution Wind farm was slated to start sending power to homes and businesses in Rhode Island and Connecticut starting next year.
item.content:encoded:
The Revolution Wind farm was slated to start sending power to homes and businesses in Rhode Island and Connecticut starting next year.

(Image credit: Seth Wenig)
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley

item.title: US seeks to deport Kilmar Abrego Garcia to Uganda
item.description: Immigration officials said they intend to deport Kilmar Abrego Garcia to Uganda after he declined an offer to be deported to Costa Rica, according to a Saturday court filing.
item.content:encoded:
Immigration officials said they intend to deport Kilmar Abrego Garcia to Uganda after he declined an offer to be deported to Costa Rica, according to a Saturday court filing.

(Image credit: Brett Carlsen)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Hawaii's Kilauea volcano erupts again and shoots lava for 31st time since December
item.description: Hawaii's Kilauea volcano resumed erupting Friday by shooting an arc of lava 100 feet into the air and across a section of its summit crater floor.
item.content:encoded:
Hawaii's Kilauea volcano resumed erupting Friday by shooting an arc of lava 100 feet into the air and across a section of its summit crater floor.

(Image credit: M. Zoeller/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Opinion: Wardrobe diplomacy
item.description: Months after his explosive meeting at the White House, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy returned this week wearing a black blazer. His dress last time invited criticism from Trump supporters.
item.content:encoded:
Months after his explosive meeting at the White House, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy returned this week wearing a black blazer. His dress last time invited criticism from Trump supporters.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: RAINBOW CROSSWALK PROTEST
item.description: The rainbow crosswalk in front of Orlando's Pulse nightclub was removed by Florida transportation officials. The crosswalk was a memorial for those killed in a 2016 mass shooting at the gay bar.
item.content:encoded: The rainbow crosswalk in front of Orlando's Pulse nightclub was removed by Florida transportation officials. The crosswalk was a memorial for those killed in a 2016 mass shooting at the gay bar.
item.dc:creator: Joe Byrnes

item.title: How international students feel arriving on campus after the revamped visa process
item.description: International students from around the world are arriving on American college campuses after a very rocky summer.
item.content:encoded: International students from around the world are arriving on American college campuses after a very rocky summer.
item.dc:creator: Elissa Nadworny

item.title: Tinted sunscreen does something regular sun protection can't
item.description: Most sunscreens protect skin from UV light but the tinted variety also block visible light. And that can be important for people with hyperpigmentation or melasma, especially those with darker skin.
item.content:encoded: Most sunscreens protect skin from UV light but the tinted variety also block visible light. And that can be important for people with hyperpigmentation or melasma, especially those with darker skin.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Muraskin

item.title: Photos: The perilous lives of miners in South Africa's abandoned mines
item.description: 'Artisanal miners' is the phrase used for South Africans who salvage coal from abandoned mines. It's a grueling and risky life. "Bit by bit it's killing something inside me," says one such miner.
item.content:encoded:
'Artisanal miners' is the phrase used for South Africans who salvage coal from abandoned mines. It's a grueling and risky life. "Bit by bit it's killing something inside me," says one such miner.

(Image credit: Tommy Trenchard for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Text and photos by Tommy Trenchard
